wifindus.eye

Class EyeApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • wifindus.eye.EyeApplication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, DeviceEventListener, IncidentEventListener, NodeEventListener, UserEventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Dispatcher, Server

    public abstract class EyeApplication
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable, DeviceEventListener, NodeEventListener, UserEventListener, IncidentEventListener
    A general base for Eye applications that need to maintain a connection to a MySQL database and respond to changes made to Users, Devices, etc.
    Author:
    Mark 'marzer' Gillard

    • Constructor Detail

      • EyeApplication

        public EyeApplication(java.lang.String[] args)
        Creates a new EyeApplication.
        Parameters:
        args - The command-line arguments used to launch the application, as provided by main. The following parameters are currently accepted:
        • -conf filename: specifies a configuration file to load. This argument may be provided more than once, with each listed config file being loaded into one ConfigFile instance. If this argument is omitted, eye.conf is assumed.
        • -0 to -4: specifies the minimum verbosity of Debugger output, from Verbose (0), to Exception (4). If this parameter is omitted, -1 is assumed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if args is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if an attempt is made to instantiate more than one EyeApplication

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes/releases the resources used by the application. This does NOT terminate the main thread (i.e. this is not the same as calling System.exit); you must still exit the program normally as per flow of execution.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
